1 Thus saith the Domina to Her anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have holden, to subdue nations before her, and to loose the loins of queens; to open the doors before her, and that the gates may not be shut: 2 I will go before thee, and make the crooked places straight; I will break in pieces the doors of brass, and cut in sunder the bars of iron; 3 And I will give thee the treasures of darkness, and hidden riches of secret places, that thou mayest know that I am the Domina, who call thee by thy name, even the God of Israel. 4 For the sake of Jacoba My servant, and Israel Mine elect, I have called thee by thy name, I have surnamed thee, though thou hast not known Me. 5 I am the Domina, and there is none else, beside Me there is no God; I have girded thee, though thou hast not known Me; 6 That they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the west, that there is none beside Me; I am the Domina; and there is none else; 7 I form the light, and create darkness; I make peace, and create evil; I am the Domina, that doeth all these things.

 8 Drop down, ye heavens, from above, and let the skies pour down righteousness; let the earth open, that they may bring forth salvation, and let him cause righteousness to spring up together; I the Domina have created it.   9 Woe unto her that striveth with her Maker, as a potsherd with the potsherds of the earth! Shall the clay say to her that fashioned it: 'What makest thou?' Or: 'Thy work, it hath no hands'?   10 Woe unto her that saith unto her mother: 'Wherefore begettest thou?' Or to a man: 'Wherefore travailest thou?'   11 Thus saith the Domina, the Holy One of Israel, and her Maker: Ask Me of the things that are to come; concerning My daughters, and concerning the work of My hands, command ye Me. 12 I, even I, have made the earth, and created woman upon it; I, even My hands, have stretched out the heavens, and all their host have I commanded.
13 I have roused her up in victory, and I make level all her ways; she shall build My city, and she shall let Mine exiles go free, not for price nor reward, saith the Domina of hosts.   14 Thus saith the Domina: The labour of Egypt, and the merchandise of Ethiopia, and of the Sabeans, women of stature, shall come over unto thee, and they shall be thine; they shall go after thee, in chains they shall come over; and they shall fall down unto thee, they shall make supplication unto thee: Surely God is in thee, and there is none else, there is no other God. 15 Verily Thou art a God that hidest Thyself, O God of Israel, the Saviour. 16 They shall be ashamed, yea, confounded, all of them; they shall go in confusion together that are makers of idols. 17 O Israel, that art saved by the Domina with an everlasting salvation; ye shall not be ashamed nor confounded world without end.

 18 For thus saith the Domina that created the heavens, She is God; that formed the earth and made it, She established it, She created it not a waste, She formed it to be inhabited: I am the Domina, and there is none else. 19 I have not spoken in secret, in a place of the land of darkness; I said not unto the seed of Jacoba: 'Seek ye Me in vain'; I the Domina speak righteousness, I declare things that are right. 20 Assemble yourselves and come, draw near together, ye that are escaped of the nations; they have no knowledge that carry the wood of their graven image, and pray unto a god that cannot save. 21 Declare ye, and bring them near, yea, let them take counsel together: Who hath announced this from ancient time, and declared it of old? Have not I the Domina? And there is no God else beside Me, a just God and a Saviour; there is none beside Me. 22 Look unto Me, and be ye saved, all the ends of the earth; for I am God, and there is none else. 23 By Myself have I sworn, the word is gone forth from My mouth in righteousness, and shall not come back, that unto Me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear. 24 Only in the Domina, shall one say of Me, is victory and strength; even to Her shall women come in confusion, all they that were incensed against Her.
